conversation.ja_sentence: 去年はMBAを取得されたばかりだそうです。

conversation.en_sentence: We're meeting him this Wednesday, just to sort out some final details.
conversation.ja_sentence: 水曜日に会うことになっています、最終的な詳細のすり合わせのためだけですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I know you're really busy, so I can handle this.
conversation.ja_sentence: お忙しいでしょうから、私がなんとかしておきますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds like a plan Mr. Paul.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました、ポールさん。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm really looking forward to the ceremony as I've never done this before.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は式典をするのは今回が初めてなのでとても楽しみです。

conversation.en_sentence: What should I expect?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな感じなんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: So, Let's move on to the topic of release date.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、発売日の話題に移りましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Gentlemen, when do you think we will be able to launch this product?
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんいつこの製品をリリースできると思いますか。

conversation.en_sentence: Walt?
conversation.ja_sentence: ウォルト？

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you Walt.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございますウォルト。

conversation.en_sentence: What's your reaction to that Bruce?
conversation.ja_sentence: どう思いますか、ブルース？

conversation.en_sentence: Go ahead, George.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうぞ、ジョージ。

conversation.en_sentence: What would you like to add?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か言いたいことがありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Walt, and Bruce what are your thoughts?
conversation.ja_sentence: ウォルト、ブルース、あなたたちはどう思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: George, is a June release feasible?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョージ、6月のリリースは実現可能ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: George, when would you say is a realistic release date?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョージ、いつころが現実的だと思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Bruce, please calm down.
conversation.ja_sentence: 落ち着いてください、ブルース。

conversation.en_sentence: Why don't we take a ten minute break?
conversation.ja_sentence: 10分休憩しませんか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Micah, what's going on?
conversation.ja_sentence: マイカ、どうしたんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: What product are you talking about?
conversation.ja_sentence: どの商品の事を言ってるんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: She really claimed it contained peanuts?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女は本当にピーナッツが混入してると主張してるんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: How did that happen?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてこの様な事になってのでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: We don't even process peanuts at our factory.
conversation.ja_sentence: 工場ではピーナツを使用する品の製造さえもしていないですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: I highly doubt they are actual peanuts though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実際はピーナツではないと思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Well, we will see.
conversation.ja_sentence: 後にわかる事です。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check the label really quickly before we hang up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 電話を切る前にちょっとラベルチェックをさせて下さい。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Well, no nuts are listed in the ingredients.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにナッツは記載されていませんね。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think it's a possibility that someone intentionally contaminated it?
conversation.ja_sentence: もしかして誰かが故意的に混入した可能性はありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: You never know although I hate to doubt the factory workers like this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 工場の従業員を疑うのは嫌だけど、実際の所はわからないものですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Then how in the world did peanuts get in our product?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ一体どうしてピーナツがうちの商品に購入したんでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: シェーン ブラウン
conversation.en_sentence: Please keep me posted on this situation.
conversation.ja_sentence: この事についてまた連絡をお願いします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Larry.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、ラリーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sam, how are you?
conversation.ja_sentence: サムさん、こんにちは、お元気ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, can you tell me the package number?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、荷物の番号を教えて頂けますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know what the size of the product is?
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品のサイズはおわかりですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure that would be helpful.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、見てみますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm just entering the information in the system now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、システムに情報を入力しているんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, it's not showing up in the system.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、システム上では表示されませんね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know when it arrived at our facility?
conversation.ja_sentence: その荷物がいつこちらの施設に届いたかおわかりですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe there's a chance that it wasn't scanned and updated yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多分、これスキャンと更新がまだされてない可能性がありますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll go take a look in the warehouse to see if I can locate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 倉庫に行って調べて、見つけられるか確認しますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about I call you back later today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日この後、お電話を折り返すということでよろしいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ラリー ブーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Talk to you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、後ほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So what did you think of the candidates.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、候補の方々、どう思う？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So they are pretty equal in terms of experience?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃぁ、経験に関しては、どっちも同じって感じ？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about in terms of personality?
conversation.ja_sentence: 性格の面ではどう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I feel that Andy is a bit more ambitious in terms of moving up the company.
conversation.ja_sentence: より良い会社に移ろうってところが、僕はアンディさんの方が野心的かなとは思うね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: This documentations coordinator position isn't exactly a position that would get you to the Tokyo office though.
conversation.ja_sentence: この書類コーディネーターのポジションは、東京オフィスに行くようなポジションじゃぁないからな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe Andy wouldn't be a good fit.
conversation.ja_sentence: アンディさんは、合わないかも。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If we do hire him, he might just quit once he realizes there is no possibility of transferring to the Tokyo office.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし彼を採用しても、東京オフィスへの転勤の可能性がないことに気付けば辞めてしまうかもしれないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Then should we go with Misato then?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃぁ、美里さんでいこうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly what Japanese companies like.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、日本の企業とは何たるかをね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: A fresh slate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 真新しい経歴だね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will let the HR department know.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった、人事部に知らせるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: When do you want her to start?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ開始してもらいたい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure you have the orientation materials and other things ready then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃぁ、オリエンテーション資料とか他のこととかちゃんと準備しといて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: どれどれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So, Andy Fujino and Misato Tamura.
conversation.ja_sentence: えぇっと、藤野 アンディさんと、田村 美里さん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How did you narrow it down to these two?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやってこの二人に絞ったの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What was so good about it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何がそんなに良かったの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good enough.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいんじゃない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: When do you want to interview them?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ面接したい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Are you positive these two are the ones you want to interview?
conversation.ja_sentence: 確実にこの二人が面接したい人たち？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, overqualified people can be difficult sometimes.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、優秀すぎる人たちはたまに難しいかもね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It might be hard for them to accept a new way of doing things.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しいやり方を受け入れるのが大変かもしれないから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, as long as you're good then I'm good.
conversation.ja_sentence: まぁ、君がいいなら、僕もいいよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll let the HR department know then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃぁ、人事部に知らせる。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm still the manager of the department!
conversation.ja_sentence: これでもこの部署の部長だからね！

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, what do you think about hiring an assistant?
conversation.ja_sentence: なぁ、サム、アシスタントを雇うのって、どう思う？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's exactly why I'm asking you.
conversation.ja_sentence: まさに、だから聞いてるんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think we should be okay in that sense.
conversation.ja_sentence: その意味では大丈夫だと思うよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I'll talk with our HR department on this.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、このことは人事部と話すよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Are there any requirements we should put on the job posting?
conversation.ja_sentence: 求人に載せたほうがいい要件とか、ある？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Anything else?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他には？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll talk to the HR department and have them upload the job posting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 人事部に話して求人をアップロードしてもらうよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll let you know when we start getting job applications so we can take a look at what we have.
conversation.ja_sentence: 応募が来出したら知らせるよ、そしたら、来たのを見てみよう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course, he or she will be your assistant.
conversation.ja_sentence: そらそうだろ、その人が、君のアシスタントになるんだから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You'll be making a shortlist and eventually interviewing them!
conversation.ja_sentence: 君が候補者リストを作って、最終的に彼らを面接するんだよ！

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I've come here on business a couple of times.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、ここには仕事で２、３回来たことある。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Their cheese toast is pretty amazing.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここのチーズトーストはかなり美味いんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The president of Company A?
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の社長？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: へぇ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But sometimes you need a break from eating-out.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、外食にも時々休みがいるよな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: When a customer comes, I have to eat out with them almost everyday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来客時は、ほとんど毎日彼らと外食しないといけないし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's nice in the beginning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初はいいんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But you will get to a point where you just want to eat instant noodles.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、ただインスタントラーメンが食べたいっていう境地に辿り着くんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well some customers are old fashioned.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、古い考えのお客さんは何人かいるな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They have the mentality of, "I do business with them because they treat me well" kind of thing.
conversation.ja_sentence: あの人たち、「彼らと仕事をするのは自分を丁重に扱ってくれるから」的な物の考え方を持ってるから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yup.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, looks like the general manager is going to give a speech now.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、今からゼネラルマネージャーがスピーチするっぽい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's enjoy the food tonight!
conversation.ja_sentence: 今夜は食事を楽しもう！

conversation.en_sentence: I'm so thrilled to be working here for the grand opening of Retail Apparel Store A!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は小売アパレルストアAのグランドオープンのために働くことができてとてもワクワクしています！

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, so how do we figure out which tags to put on which items?
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、どのタグをどのアイテムに付けるのか、どうすればわかりますか。

conversation.en_sentence: Bar codes are crazy.
conversation.ja_sentence: バーコードってすごいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: How do they even work?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういう仕組みになっているんでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's really cool that you know all of that Candace.
conversation.ja_sentence: それを全部知っているなんて本当にすごいです、キャンディス。

conversation.en_sentence: Where did you learn so much about barcodes and scanners?
conversation.ja_sentence: バーコードとスキャナーについてどこで勉強したんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: No, I haven't.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、ありません。

conversation.en_sentence: This is the first time.
conversation.ja_sentence: これが初めてです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's a very unique experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 特別な体験です。

conversation.en_sentence: I wonder how customers will like the new store.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様は新しい店を気に入ってくれるでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: It must be an amazing experience doing what you do.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは素晴らしい経験でしょうね。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't imagine traveling the world, and opening so many new stores.
conversation.ja_sentence: 世界を旅して沢山の新しい店を開いていくなんて想像がつかないです。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any advice for new managers like me?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のような新しいマネージャーに何かアドバイスはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Thankfully, they were very understanding about the whole situation.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがたいことに、顧客サイドはその状況についてとてもよく理解してくれました。

conversation.en_sentence: I explained that the shipment was stuck in customs, and that I had solved it by providing the Hong Kong Port authorities with the proper information.
conversation.ja_sentence: 積荷が税関で止まっていたので香港港湾当局に適宜情報を提供し、解決したと説明しました。

conversation.en_sentence: Eventually, we decided to give our customers a 10 percent discount, as they have been with us for several years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結局私達はその顧客らに10パーセントの割引を適応することにしました、数年来の顧客ですから。

conversation.en_sentence: Everyone knows that Company B's Products are the best in the field.
conversation.ja_sentence: B社の製品がこの分野で最高峰であることは周知の事です。

conversation.en_sentence: Your CEO Bill Higgins is a genius and is always innovative.
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社の最高経営責任者であるビル・ヒギンズは天才であり、常に革新的です。

conversation.en_sentence: I actually have a few friends that work here as well and they tell me that the culture is great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は御社で働いている友人が何人かいまして、社風が素晴らしいと聞きました。

conversation.en_sentence: They said it is mature and that management and employees all have a deep respect for each other.
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社は成熟していて、経営陣と従業員が皆お互いに深く尊敬しあっていると聞きました。

conversation.en_sentence: Over the past decade, a lot of companies try to force a "fun" culture, and it's so contrived.
conversation.ja_sentence: 過去10年間で、多くの企業が 「楽しい」社風を押し付ける傾向にありますが、わざとらしいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to play ping pong at work, and I don't need any prizes for performance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は仕事でピンポンをしたいわけではないですし、パフォーマンスのために賞品は必要ありません。

conversation.en_sentence: I simply can't even entertain a base under 60,000 dollar a year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 年間60,000ドル以下のベースは単純に考えておりません。

conversation.en_sentence: What are your thoughts on that Cheryl?
conversation.ja_sentence: それについてはどうお考えになりますか、シェリル？

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしいです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm available as soon as next Monday!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は早くて来週の月曜日には勤務可能です！

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, I can't imagine being a doctor.
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、僕には医者になるなんて想像できませんよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's just too much responsibility for me to handle.
conversation.ja_sentence: 責任が重すぎます。

conversation.en_sentence: If I make a mistake at my job, all I have to do is go back in my computer and amend a document.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕が仕事を間違えた場合は、コンピュータに戻って文書を修正するだけですから。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe make a phone call.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとは電話をかけるくらいかな。

conversation.en_sentence: However, for doctors, someone's life and health is on the line.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも医者の場合は誰かの人生と健康がかかっているんですから。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I heard about a doctor a few months ago that had to go to court over a lawsuit where a patient had died in surgery.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、僕は数ヶ月前に患者が手術で死亡した訴訟で裁判所に行かなければならなかった医師について聞きましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's heavy Cameron.

conversation.en_sentence: Well, that's a pretty good deal, right?

conversation.en_sentence: I don't understand any of this.

conversation.en_sentence: The president of Company A wanted to ask us if we can extend the term from ten days to forty five days.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の社長が条件を10日から45日以内に変えられるか聞いてきたんだが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, but since we've been working with Company A for so long, I don't think it will be an issue.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだ、だが、A社とは長い付き合いだし、問題はないかと思うんだけどね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I've already talked to our risk management department and they are okay with it.
conversation.ja_sentence: すでにリスクマネジメント部とも話したんだが、いいと言っている。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I need you to revise the invoice from now on.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、今後の請求書は修正してほしいんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We will start from the shipment next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の出荷分から始めよう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you also let our administration department know?
conversation.ja_sentence: 総務部にも伝えておいてくれる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It'd be good to give them a heads up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 知らせておいた方がいいからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure they will come ask us if the terms are correct since forty five days is pretty long.
conversation.ja_sentence: 45日はかなり長いので、条件が正しいのか、きっと確認に来ると思うよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: よろしく、ありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I haven't heard anything about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何も聞いてないけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We've had a trainee come for one year for the past four years so I would think someone will be coming again.
conversation.ja_sentence: 過去４年間、研修生が一年間いたから、また誰か来るんじゃないかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's always nice to have someone new in the office.
conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスに新しい人が来てくれるのはいいことだよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I know for the first two trainees that we had, their goal was to practice English.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここに来た最初の2人の目標は、英語の練習だったな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think they had a goal of scoring 700 on this English test.
conversation.ja_sentence: この英語のテストで700点とるのが目標だったはず。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'd do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But for the recent trainees, they've actually been sending us people who are pretty experienced.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、最近の研修生に関して言えば、すごく経験のある人が派遣されてきてるよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like, their goal is not to learn English but to actually find new businesses.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らの目標は英語の勉強じゃなくて、実際に新たなビジネスを探すことみたいだよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: No, I've never heard of that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ううん、聞いたことないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I've heard of someone in the New York office go on a training program in Japan.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実際に、ニューヨークオフィスの社員が研修プログラムで日本に行くっていうのは聞いたことがあるけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But he is in the legal department.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、それは法務部の人だけどね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Would you want to go to Japan?
conversation.ja_sentence: 日本へ行きたい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Same here!
conversation.ja_sentence: 同じく！

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Sam Lee from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社のサム リーです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm doing good, thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: I actually called your office earlier but the receptionist said you were out of the office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、先ほどオフィスにお電話したのですが、外出されていると受付の方がおっしゃっていました。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, where are you at now?
conversation.ja_sentence: へえ、今どちらですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, sorry for bothering you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、それはお邪魔してすみません。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうですか。

conversation.en_sentence: So I wanted to ask you for a quote for Product A.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、商品Aの見積もりをいただきたかったのです。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can get me this by the end of the week?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今週末までにいただけそうでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: We will arrange our own trucking at your mill.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらの製材所で当社のトラック輸送を手配します。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm looking for twenty eight metric tons.
conversation.ja_sentence: 28トンを考えています。

conversation.en_sentence: So that's two twenty feet containers.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、20フィートコンテナ２基ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった、よろしくお願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Hope you enjoy the rest of the conference.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、残りの会議も良いものになるといいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Is the phone conference confirmed for next week?
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の電話会議は決まったのかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Still the same date and time right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 日にちと時間に変更なし？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes I do.
conversation.ja_sentence: あります。

conversation.en_sentence: I want to start off with company introductions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社紹介から始めたいんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Afterwards, I want to explain the potential business opportunity.
conversation.ja_sentence: その後、ビジネスチャンスについて説明したいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes that would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かりますね。

conversation.en_sentence: I want to see if they can introduce us to their parent company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 親会社をうちに紹介してもらえるかどうか聞いてみたいんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Their parent company is called Company B, and they have a large presence in South East Asia.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の親会社はB社といって、東南アジアでたくさん事業展開しているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We also have operations in South East Asia so we can explore opportunities there as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちも東南アジアでは事業をやっていますから、ビジネスチャンスを探れるかもしれませんね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes that would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds right.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでいいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for arranging this.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご手配お世話になります。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no you're not.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやいや、そうじゃないですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: So, you mean you want me to fill Mari's position?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、僕に真理さんの後を継いでほしいということですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm flattered that you use American colloquialism, but don’t you think Eugina is more of an appropriate choice?
conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカの口語表現を使ってくれて嬉しいですが、ユージニアさんのほうがもっと適役だとは思いませんか。

conversation.en_sentence: Just hire someone new for Global Relations and Eugina can manage Sales.
conversation.ja_sentence: グローバルリレーションズに新しく誰かを雇えば、ユージニアさんが営業を管理できます。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean she has an MBA from an Ivy League and at least a decade of management experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女アイビーリーグのMBAを持っていますし、最低でも１０年間の管理職経験があります。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I kind of heard about it, but...
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、聞いたような気はしますが...

conversation.en_sentence: You know I'm a college dropout.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大学中退なのはご存知ですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I don't even know how I ended up being hired.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、どうやって雇われることになったのかも分からないくらいです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm finding out everyone else here is an Ivy Leaguer.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここでは周りの皆がアイビーリーグ出身だと分かるようになってきました。

conversation.en_sentence: Mari, John, Eugina, Taichi, Won Bin, Yumi, all of our scientists, not to mention our management, and Kate!
conversation.ja_sentence: 真理さん、ジョンさん、ユージニアさん、太一さん、ウォンビンさん、由美さん、科学者たち全員、経営陣はもちろんのこと、ケイトさんも！

conversation.en_sentence: Jesus, she was Harvard's Summa cum laude!
conversation.ja_sentence: なんたって、彼女はハーバードを首席で卒業ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you just not rub it in.
conversation.ja_sentence: それ以上、言わないでくださいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko's going to block it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 恵子さんが邪魔するんじゃないですか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I think your replies were very smooth.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、あなたの回答はスムーズでしたね。

conversation.en_sentence: I couldn't agree more.
conversation.ja_sentence: まったく同感です。

conversation.en_sentence: Investors tend to think about immediate return.
conversation.ja_sentence: 投資家たちは即時の見返りを求めますからね。

conversation.en_sentence: That is not how we do things.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはうちのやり方じゃありません。

conversation.en_sentence: But they don't seem to see that we are the driving force behind the IPO.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、この株式公開の原動力となっているのが私たちだってことには気づいていませんよね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's not them, it's us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らじゃなくて私たちですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course, so we have been taking their advice to add more investors, even though we don't need any.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、だから彼らのアドバイスに従って、別に必要はないけれど、投資家を増やしているんでしょ。

conversation.en_sentence: We accepted C Fund to hold our shares.
conversation.ja_sentence: Cファンドに株を所有してもらうことを受け入れましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think there are any issues there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 別にそこに問題はないと思いますが。

conversation.en_sentence: I've been doing this for years, Vaughn.
conversation.ja_sentence: ヴォーンさん、私は何年もこれをやってきています。

conversation.en_sentence: It's not like I need to learn anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何も学ぶ必要はありませんよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Our company is not like your run of the mill company.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社は、ありふれた会社じゃないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's very distinct.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても特別です。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ。

conversation.en_sentence: The IT guys had to spend a week getting the intranet lines sorted out because they weren’t told anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: ITの人たち、何も教えられてなかったから、一週間もかけてイントラネットラインを何とかしたんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: And you know how the intranet is organized.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、イントラネットがどれだけ整備されているか知ってるよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't see anything from the lab even though I'm in charge of relaying our customers' needs and checking on the progress of the lab.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は、顧客のニーズを伝えたり研究室の進捗をチェックしたりする担当だけど、研究室からは何にも見えないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, she is just here for the money and she's ok with that.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、彼女はここにお金のためだけにいて、それでいいらしいけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, she's kind of Zen, and hardly ever takes things personally.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、彼女は禅の精神持ってて、個人的に物を捉えることがほとんどないよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Some people are content where they are and are not interesting in advancing their positions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今いるところに満足して、昇進に興味がない人もいるからな。

conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, didn't mean that in any disrespectful manner.
conversation.ja_sentence: ごめん、別に見下すつもりで言ったんじゃないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: When did you join Company R?
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はいつR社に入ったんだっけ？

conversation.en_sentence: Who referred you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰に紹介されたの？

conversation.en_sentence: You mean, you went to Yale?
conversation.ja_sentence: それって、イェールに行ったってこと？

conversation.en_sentence: Why do we have so many Ivy Leaguers here?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして、ここにはアイビーリーグ大学出身者が多いんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Am I the only college dropout here?
conversation.ja_sentence: 大学中退したのって俺だけか？

conversation.en_sentence: Hey you two, did you go to the new year party last Friday?
conversation.ja_sentence: なあ、二人とも、先週金曜の新年会には行った？

conversation.en_sentence: I had to go home straight from work because my wife is home sick with the kids.
conversation.ja_sentence: 奥さんが体調が悪くて子供たちと家で待ってたから、仕事からまっすぐ家に帰らないといけなかったんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, you know how our company is vying for a spot of blue ocean in the wearable tech industry, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、うちの会社がウェアラブルテクノロジー業界の未開拓分野に入り込もうと競い合ってるのは知ってるだろ？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, they've started up project "Cyclops" to explore unexploited areas in the wearable tech industry.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、ウェアラブルテクノロジー業界の未開拓分野を探求するための「サイクロップス」プロジェクトを立ち上げたんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't know much about it, but Sally in corporate planning said they had some intel about Company B's progress in the AI field just before the CEO made the announcement.
conversation.ja_sentence: よく知らないんだけど、経営企画部のサリーによると、CEOがその発表をする直前に、B社のAI分野での進捗について調べたらしいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I am trying to take it as a compliment, but honestly it's the worst timing for me.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、褒め言葉と思いたいけど、正直言うと最悪のタイミングなんだよな。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, my daughter Kyler.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ、娘のカイラー。

conversation.en_sentence: No worries, it's nothing I haven't done before.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だよ、前にやったことがないわけじゃないし。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you remember how it was when the whole company had to start learning Python because the CEO wanted us all to "have the spirit of SEs"?
conversation.ja_sentence: CEOが、僕たち全員に「SEの心を持つように」って全社あげてパイソンを習わなきゃいけなかった時のこと覚えてる？

conversation.en_sentence: See, there is always something to be grateful for!
conversation.ja_sentence: な、いつもありがたいことばっかりあるだろう！

conversation.en_sentence: Hah, yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: ははは、そうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I've got to get back because of a meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、ミーティングがあるから、戻らなくちゃ。

conversation.en_sentence: See you later!
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、後でな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Jack from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のジャックです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me the invoice number for this?
conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書番号を教えていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, let me just pull this out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、今探してみますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: So yes I do see the unit rate at five hundred fifty dollars here.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、そのようですね、ここでは単価550ドルとなっています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me who you spoke to in regards to the price?
conversation.ja_sentence: 料金について誰とお話されましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me just confirm the price with Tom and I'll get back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: トムに値段を確認してからお返事差し上げます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Once I can confirm it, I'll send you a revised invoice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認できたら、修正した請求書をお送りいたします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll update you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに連絡いたします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック ヒギンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、また。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sam, this is Cheryl from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、サムさん、A社のシェリルです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, since last year's audit.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、去年の監査以来です。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I'm calling to schedule a date to conduct this year's audit.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、今年の監査の日程を決めようとお電話さしあげたのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Time flies doesn't it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時の経つのは早いですよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I need to do the audit by the end of the fiscal year.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、本年度末までに監査をする必要があるのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I know it's still November now but I thought it'd best to confirm a date for this before the holiday break.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだ11月なのは分かっていますが、ホリデー休暇に入る前に日程を確定しておいたほうがいいと思ったので。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, I can take a look at my schedule and give you some options on the date.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、私のほうの予定を見て、候補日をいくつかあげますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I can send you a list of documents that I will need.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、必要な書類の一覧をお送りすることができます。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: It will be the price that we agreed to last year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 去年合意した値段になります。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So same price as last year which was five thousand dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、去年と同額で5000ドルです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I will get back to you with some dates and a list of documents I will need.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、候補日と必要書類一覧について後で連絡しますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ。

conversation.ja_speaker: シェリル タナーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Talk to you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではまた。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sam, how can I help you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、サムさん、どういったご用でしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is it a rush shipment?
conversation.ja_sentence: おや、お急ぎの輸送ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: How much volume are you talking about?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらいの量をお考えですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: What would the dimension of the package be?
conversation.ja_sentence: 荷物の大きさはどのくらいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it really depends on the volume and dimensions of the goods.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、それはもうものの量と大きさによりますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it's kind of hard to say.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、一概にどうとは言えません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: But obviously, it will be a lot more expensive to ship by air than sea.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、船便よりもずっと高いのは明らかですよ。

conversation.ja_sentence: 4時までに本部長にプレゼンを提出することになっているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I can try.
conversation.ja_sentence: やってみます。

conversation.en_sentence: I can do some overtime today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日残業することもできますが。

conversation.en_sentence: Would that be okay?
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫かい？

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それならやれそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So how has the new guy been?
conversation.ja_sentence: 新人はどう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah him.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、彼。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How long has he been with us for?
conversation.ja_sentence: もうどれくらいになる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The first year is always the toughest.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一年目はいつも一番大変だよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's not easy if the job is boring.
conversation.ja_sentence: 退屈な仕事だとなかなか大変だよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Or if it isn't your dream job.
conversation.ja_sentence: それか自分の理想の仕事と違うとね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I hope he sticks around.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼が長続きするといいな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Changing jobs after just one year of work experience doesn't look too good on a resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一年だけ仕事を経験して転職するのは、履歴書上あまりよくないからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's a tough job market right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 求人市場もなかなか今は難しいしね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He should at least try to aim for three years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少なくとも３年は目指したほうがいいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nah.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやぁ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I might talk to his boss though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の上司に話をしてみるかもね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I'll tell him to go easier on Roy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ロイに厳しく当たらないように話してみるかも。

conversation.en_sentence: You mean Roy Sasaoka?
conversation.ja_sentence: 佐々岡 ロイのこと？

conversation.en_sentence: I think just over a year now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一年ちょっとかな。

conversation.en_sentence: He seems to be working hard and learning quickly.
conversation.ja_sentence: 頑張ってるし、覚えもよさそうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: His boss seems a bit tough on him though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の上司がちょっと彼にはきついみたいだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope he doesn't burn out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 体調崩さないといいけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah that's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、そうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: I've learned to just accept the job as just a job.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事はただの仕事だって考えることにしたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Put in the work and get paid.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事をして、給料をもらう。

conversation.en_sentence: Rinse and repeat.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてまた同じことを繰り返す。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah you want at least one and a half to two years right.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、少なくとも１年半から２年はいたいよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you going to talk to him about it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼にその話してみるの？

conversation.en_sentence: That would be a good idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、いい考えだね。

conversation.en_sentence: It would be a bummer to see him go.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼がいなくなったら嫌だからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Ben, I'm thinking about taking a couple of weeks off in December.
conversation.ja_sentence: なぁベン、12月に2、3週間の休みを取ろうと思ってるんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I'm thinking I should see my family in Taiwan.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、台湾の家族に会いに行かないと、っと思ってて。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm looking at leaving just before Christmas and coming back in the new year.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょうどクリスマス前に出て、お正月に戻って来るので考えてる。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I can just take 3 days off in the week and have the whole week off.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、その週は三日だけ休みを取れば一週間丸々休みが取れるし。

conversation.en_sentence: Not that I know of.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、特に思いつかない。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll be taking the company laptop with me so I'll be checking emails every now and then.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社のラップトップを持っていくし、時々メールもチェックするよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course!
conversation.ja_sentence: そらそうだよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh I don't plan on working that much.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやいや、そこまで働くつもりはないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll just check emails once a day at home.
conversation.ja_sentence: 家で一日に一回チェックするくらい。

conversation.en_sentence: It is a vacation after all.
conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱり休暇だからね。

conversation.en_sentence: How about you?
conversation.ja_sentence: そっちは？

conversation.en_sentence: Are you going to go anywhere during the holidays?
conversation.ja_sentence: 休みの間どこか行くつもり？

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds exciting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 楽しそうだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thinking of going away for the holidays?
conversation.ja_sentence: 休暇でどこかに行こうって？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah why not.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、そうだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know when you're thinking of going?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ頃で考えてる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That should be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃぁ、大丈夫だね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There's a lot of holidays during that period.
conversation.ja_sentence: その期間は祝日がいっぱいあるし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know if there is anything you need me to take care of while you're away?
conversation.ja_sentence: 休みの間に何かこっちでやっておくこととかありそう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Aren't you hardworking.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごい働くよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You should ask the administration department to get you a mobile wifi.
conversation.ja_sentence: 管理部にモバイルWiFiを持たせてもらえるように頼んだほうがいいよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そっか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nevermind then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃぁ、いいか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I thought of travelling but Christmas shopping set me back a bit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 旅行しようって思ってたけど、クリスマスの買い物でちょっと頓挫してるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm just going to stay in the area and save some money.
conversation.ja_sentence: この辺に留まって節約するよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very exciting.
conversation.ja_sentence: かなり楽しそう。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Kyle from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもしA社のカイルです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not too bad.
conversation.ja_sentence: えぇ、元気です。

conversation.en_sentence: I know we confirmed a meeting for next week a couple days ago, and was wondering if we can reschedule.
conversation.ja_sentence: 2，3日前に来週の会議を決めたのは承知なんですが、再調整できないかと思いまして。

conversation.en_sentence: I was thinking something near the end of the month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 月末かその辺りで考えていたんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes that would be perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 完璧です。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, my manager, Bob will be coming as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、うちのマネージャーの、ボブも来ます。

conversation.en_sentence: We can still have the meeting at our office if you'd like.
conversation.ja_sentence: よろしければうちの事務所で会議することも可能ですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん。

conversation.en_sentence: Your office is still at the same floor right?
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらのオフィスってまだ同じ階にありますよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the confirmation and understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解とご確認、ありがとうごいます。

conversation.en_sentence: We'll look forward to seeing you.
conversation.ja_sentence: お会いできるのを楽しみにしていますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Goodbye.
conversation.ja_sentence: では。

conversation.en_sentence: When should I call Mr. Kinoshita from Company A?
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の木下さんに何時に電話したらいいでしょう？

conversation.en_sentence: Right.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: It will be 9 o'clock in the morning in Japan when it is 5 o'clock in the afternoon here.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらが午後5時のときに日本は午前9時ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will call them around 5 o'clock then.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、では、こちらの午後5時くらいに電話します。

conversation.en_sentence: I need to tell him that a shipment will be delayed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出荷が遅れることを伝えたいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Well the logistic company only told me that it will be delayed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 物流会社からは遅れるとしか聞いてないです。

conversation.en_sentence: Nothing more.
conversation.ja_sentence: それ以上のことはわかりません。

conversation.en_sentence: Good point.
conversation.ja_sentence: そりゃそうだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I will call the logistic company right now to find out the reason.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、物流会社に電話して理由を問いただします。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、アドバイスをどうも。

conversation.en_sentence: Good thing I asked you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞いてよかった。

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise I would have been yelled at by Mr. Kinoshita.
conversation.ja_sentence: 木下さんに怒鳴られるところだった。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll keep note of that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 心しておきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will be sending out an excel file with a list of company today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日、会社リストをエクセルファイルで送ります。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's for sending out the company Christmas card and calendar!
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社のクリスマスカードとカレンダーの送付リストです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will need you to look over the list to see if we still do business with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだウチの取引先かどうか、リストを確認してほしいんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: If we aren't doing business with them anymore then we don't need to send it to them.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう、取引していないようでしたら、送付する必要ないので。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please make sure the addresses are correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: それと、住所が正しいかどうか確認してください。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will have to look it up online to check if it has changed or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: 住所が変わっていないかどうかネットでチェックする必要があります。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will leave that up to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの判断にお任せします。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's not a big deal to send out more so you don't have to overthink it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 送り先が増えてもそれほど大変じゃないので、そんなに真剣に考えなくても大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to finalize it by this week so we can send them out next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今週中に仕上げて、来週送りたいのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: That should be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I plan on sending them out in the latter half of next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週後半に送りたいと思っていますので。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Just let me know by Tuesday next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の火曜日までに知らせてくれればいいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi there, this is John Smith from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、私A社のジョンスミスと申します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: May I speak to Mr. Willis?
conversation.ja_sentence: ウィリスさんはいらっしゃいますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Mr. Willis, how are you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ウィリスさん、お元気ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm not too bad myself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もまあまあです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm calling today to ask if you would be available for a lunch meeting next Tuesday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は来週の火曜日にランチミーティングができるかお尋ねするためにお電話差し上げました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: よかった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: How does Restaurant A at 12 o'clock sound?
conversation.ja_sentence: 12時にレストランAでいいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: My manager would actually like to discuss a new business opportunity.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちのマネージャーが新しいビジネスの機会について話したいと思っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: And he thought it'd be best if we talk about this over lunch.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、昼食を食べながらその話ができたらいいと思っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will look forward to seeing you as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もお会いできるのを楽しみにしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: さようなら。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben, it's nice to see you again.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさん、こんにちは、またお会いできて嬉しいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's been a bit slow with the holiday season but that's normal.
conversation.ja_sentence: 休暇のシーズンでちょっと活気がないですが、それが普通です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the one regarding the market research.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、マーケットリサーチに関する件ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you be a bit more specific?
conversation.ja_sentence: もう少し具体的にお話して頂けますか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Were you expecting more field work like interviewing companies?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社への聞き取り調査など、もっと実地調査を期待されていましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: If that's the case, the cost structure for our service would be different.
conversation.ja_sentence: その場合、私共のサービスの料金体制が変わってきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: It will be a combination.
conversation.ja_sentence: 組み合わせになりますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: So there will be the base price plus a monthly retainer fee for the duration of the field work.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから基本料金の上に、実地調査を行う期間中に月々の依頼料がかかります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Also, travel expense and a daily meal allowance would have to be covered as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、旅費と毎日の食費もかかります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I can whip that up quickly.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、すぐにご用意できます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think I can get you a revised proposal by the end of the week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 週末までに改訂した提案をお渡しします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will do.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ジェームスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the opportunity.
conversation.ja_sentence: 機会を頂き、ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Wow that's a lot.
conversation.ja_sentence: わぁ、こんなに沢山。

conversation.en_sentence: How long was the posting up for?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらい掲載されてた？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, let's do it.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、見ようか。

conversation.en_sentence: So what's the tip in screening job applications?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、求人の応募を審査するコツって何？

conversation.en_sentence: I'll give it a try.
conversation.ja_sentence: やってみるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見てみよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh this person is interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: わぁ、この人いいね。

conversation.en_sentence: He used to work at a shipping company as a logistics coordinator.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、輸送会社で物流コーディネーターとして働いてたって。

conversation.en_sentence: He's older than me too.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかも僕より年上だ。

conversation.en_sentence: That could make things awkward right?
conversation.ja_sentence: それって気まずくならない？

conversation.en_sentence: Good point.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいとこ突くね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll think about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 考えてみるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't wait to meet them!
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らに会うのが待ちきれないよ！

conversation.en_sentence: You flatter me.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやあ照れます。

conversation.en_sentence: It was hectic, but we made it through.
conversation.ja_sentence: めちゃくちゃ忙しかったですけど、なんとか終わらせました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for saying so.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, actually if it wouldn't have had the support from you and the entire department, I cold have never done it.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやあ、あなたや部の人たちのサポートがなかったらそうはいかなかったと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: What?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What's going on?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What!?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当ですか！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh that's great Kim.
conversation.ja_sentence: わあ、嬉しいです、キム。

conversation.en_sentence: How much?
conversation.ja_sentence: いくらなんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh my god, that's too much Kim.
conversation.ja_sentence: うわあ、多すぎますよ、キム。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: This is amazing.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごく嬉しいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yeah, for sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, this is Harry from the warehouse, how may I help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます、こちら倉庫担当のハリーですが、どのようなご用件ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry, as I wrote in the email the new year calendar might arrive late.
conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ないです、メールにも書いた通り、新年のカレンダーが届くのは遅れるかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: Our vendor said it will be delivered around early January.
conversation.ja_sentence: 業者によると一月の頭ごろには届くということです。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、そうします。

conversation.en_sentence: Just to make sure, you ordered 200 pieces right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認のためですが、200部注文されましたよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I would also like to tell you that our vendor will not send the calendar to your office at once, but divided into several batches.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、あと、カレンダーは業者から一括してではなく、幾つかのバッチに分けて送られる予定だということもお伝えしておきますね。

conversation.en_sentence: So, maybe if you ordered 200 pieces, I can give you around 50 pieces at first.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、200部注文されたとしたら、まず50部ほどお渡しできます。

conversation.en_sentence: And then, if our vendor send it again the next day, I can give you another 50 calendars.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、次の日に業者からまた送られてきたら、さらに50部お渡しできます。

conversation.en_sentence: This is because we also need to deliver the calendar to our branch offices throughout the country.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは、全国の支社にもカレンダーを届ける必要があるからなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: And we need time for delivery to our branch offices.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、支社に届ける時間が必要なので。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else I can help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に何かお手伝いできますか？

conversation.en_sentence: You're welcome.
conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello all, thank you for gathering today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん、こんにちは、今日はお集まりくださいましてありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Yichin do you mind if we all speak English today as Sylar is here?
conversation.ja_sentence: ユーチン、今日はサイラーがいるので、全員英語でもいいでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: So I've got you 2 on the phone because I wanted to make sure we are on the same page regarding your fund's intentions with our company.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、当社に関するあなた方のファンドの考えについて、全員同じ認識だということを確認するため、今日はお2人にも電話で参加してもらいました。

conversation.en_sentence: Sylar has given me some feedback in confidence as to some concerns he has.
conversation.ja_sentence: サイラーからは、懸念があるとのフィードバックを内々でいただいています。

conversation.en_sentence: Yichin, it's fine, you don't have to sugar coat.
conversation.ja_sentence: ユーチン、いいんです、言葉を選ばなくてもいいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, you told me she didn't answer any of your questions..
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、あなたの質問には全く答えなかったと言ってましたね。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't know what to say other than I deeply apologize for their behavior.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の経営陣のふるまいについては、深くお詫びを申し上げる以外に言葉もございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Meaning?
conversation.ja_sentence: といいますと？

conversation.en_sentence: I don't know her personal affairs, or her medical history, so I can't really weigh in on that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 個人的なことや病歴などはわかりませんので、なんとも言えません。

conversation.en_sentence: But I do believe something needs to be done for the sustainability of our company and I am counting on C Fund for direction.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、当社の持続可能性のためには、策を講じる必要があることは確かで、当社の方向性はCファンドにかかっております。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for being straight with me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 率直に言ってくださりありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I actually think this is a good wakeup call for them.
conversation.ja_sentence: えー、実のところ、これはうちの経営陣への警鐘だと思いますね。

conversation.en_sentence: If they know C Fund is losing interest, they may finally get their act together.
conversation.ja_sentence: Cファンドが関心を失っていることを当社の経営陣が知ったら、きちんと対処するでしょうから。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sergei.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも、セルゲイ。

conversation.en_sentence: So Dr. Toshinaga forwarded me your CV and I believe you are exactly the person we need.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、利永さんからあなたの履歴書を転送してもらいましたが、まさに当社に必要な人材だと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Basically you will be doing what you have done at your previous company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的に前の会社でやっていたのと同じ事をしていただきます。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be overseeing the sales office system and taking care of their issues.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業所のシステムの監督と問題への対処をしていただきます。

conversation.en_sentence: There will be some backend work on our website when necessary, as well as taking care of our enterprise system.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基幹システムの管理と同様に、必要に応じて当社のウェブサイトのバックエンドの仕事も発生します。

conversation.en_sentence: The enterprise system is something we just installed, and the learning curve for our employees is quite steep.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基幹システムは導入したばかりのもので、学習過程は従業員にとってかなり険しいものです。

conversation.en_sentence: They are going to have a lot of questions, so I will guide you through the basics so you can deal with the tickets.
conversation.ja_sentence: たくさんの質問が出ると思うので、これらに対処できるよう基本をご案内します。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, Sergei watch out!
conversation.ja_sentence: うわ、セルゲイ危ない！

conversation.en_sentence: Sergei, I'm so sorry, let me grab a towel.
conversation.ja_sentence: セルゲイ、申し訳ない、タオルを持ってきます。

conversation.en_sentence: Here, Sergei, let me take that jacket so I can blow it with this dryer.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、セルゲイ、ドライヤーで乾かすのでジャケットを貸してください。

conversation.en_sentence: I apologize for this mess, please send us your dry-cleaning bill.
conversation.ja_sentence: めちゃくちゃなことになって申し訳ありませんでした、クリーニング代は請求してください。

conversation.en_sentence: I insist.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必ずですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's great, Dr. Toshinaga.
conversation.ja_sentence: さすが、利永さん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's the one to Shanghai.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは上海に行くやつだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Are you asking about the Company?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社について聞いてるのかい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It should be the same as the last shipment to Shanghai.
conversation.ja_sentence: この前の上海宛の便と同じはずだけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it should be Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: だからB社だね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But don't quote me on it.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも確実なことは言えないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, why don't you check the phytosanitary application that Elaine sent out yesterday?
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、エレインが昨日送ってた植物検疫申請書を確認してみたら？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That should have the information you're looking for.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君が探してる情報が載ってるはずだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It should have been yesterday morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日の朝のはずだけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認させて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, she sent it out around 11 o'clock yesterday.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、昨日の11時頃に送ってるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, but she didn't Cc you in the email.
conversation.ja_sentence: あれ、でも君をccに入れてなかったんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'll do that now.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、今やるね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll send her a note to always include you in these kind of emails.
conversation.ja_sentence: こういうメールには必ず君も入れるように言っておくよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Scott, have you got a minute?
conversation.ja_sentence: スコット、ちょっといい？

conversation.en_sentence: I was wondering if you could do me a favor.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっとお願いがあるんだけど、いいかしら。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, John has asked me to design and write a brochure to promote the new service.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが、新サービス宣伝用のパンフをデザインして文面を作るようにジョンに頼まれたんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to let him down, but with the sales reports due for next week and the trade show to prepare for, it's a bit much for me to take on at the moment.
conversation.ja_sentence: がっかりさせたくはないんだけど、私も来週提出の売上報告書があるし、準備しなくちゃいけない展示会もあるし、今それを引き受ける暇ないのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: If you have the time, I was hoping you might be able to whip something up?
conversation.ja_sentence: もし、時間があったら、何か手早くできる案がないかなと思って。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but graphic design is not my forte.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだけど、グラフィックデザインは得意じゃないのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Plus, I now need to put all my effort into things like the trade show, to help get my baby released to consumers.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、今は、大事に育ててきた製品をお客さんにお披露目する展示会に全力を注がないといけないの。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I remember what a great job you did on the design work for the M contract.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうよ、M社との契約のときにすごく良いデザインしたの覚えてる。

conversation.en_sentence: I know it will be done well if I leave it in your hands.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたに任せておけば、素晴らしく仕上がると思う。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もちろん。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks Scott, I really appreciate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうスコット、すごく助かる。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll be on hand if you have any questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か質問があったらいつでも聞いて。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll be out of the office for a bit with the preparations, so you might have to reach me by email.
conversation.ja_sentence: 準備でちょっと外出するから、メールで連絡してもらうことになるかも。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Laura, can we talk for a bit now?
conversation.ja_sentence: やあローラ、今ちょっといい？

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh by the way, how was your holiday?
conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、そういえば、お休みどうだった？

conversation.en_sentence: Did you enjoy Lisbon?
conversation.ja_sentence: リスボン楽しめた？

conversation.en_sentence: Haha!
conversation.ja_sentence: あはは！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh that's nice!
conversation.ja_sentence: いいね！

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure he cooks some for me too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の分も作ってくれるように言っといて。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, so, I wanted to set a meeting with Company T next week and I was wondering when you would be available to attend.
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、えっと、来週にT社とのミーティングをしたくて、君がいつ空いてるか知りたかったんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Basically they can do any day so it's up to us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方はいつでも大丈夫みたいだから、僕たちの都合で決めていい。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok thanks!
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解、ありがとう！

conversation.en_sentence: I can do Wednesday too so that's great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も水曜日空いてるからちょうどいいや。

conversation.en_sentence: I will email them then set the time and let you know.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方にメールで伝えて、時間が決まったらまた言うね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks!
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう！
はいはい、何でしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, what is it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 品物と予算は決まっているんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know what you want to send and how much you want to spend?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、オフィス移転の場合は観葉植物が多いでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: For a move, how about a decorative indoor plant?

conversation.ja_sentence: グリーンレンタルの業者を利用している会社も多いですけど、喜ばれますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: There are many firms who rent potted plants for their offices, but most still seem very happy to receive something like that as a gift.

conversation.ja_sentence: 特に、会議室や応接室が沢山あるオフィスだとインテリアとして重宝されますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Especially if they have many conference and meeting rooms, they are perfect as decorations.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに、観葉植物だと長期間置いてもらえますからね。
conversation.en_sentence: They also last for a long time.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、贈り主の名前が入った立て札を付けたままにしてあると、当社の名前がその会社に訪れた方の目につきますしね。
conversation.en_sentence: We can also add a plaque with our company name with the gift which will show their visiting clients our relationship.

conversation.ja_sentence: 種類でいうと、パキラやユッカ、ベンジャミンなんかが多いですかね。
conversation.en_sentence: We usually choose pachira, yucca and ficus benjamina...

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算は１万５千円から２万円くらいでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Our budget is usually somewhere between 15,000 and 20,000 yen.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、無難な感じです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, something pretty ordinary.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました。
conversation.en_sentence: OK, I will do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 立て札に記入する名前はどうしましょう？
conversation.en_sentence: What name should I ask to put on the plaque?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、早速手配しておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it, I will make arrangements immediately.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつもお世話になっております、I社の高田です。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as always, I am Takada from Company I.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、能勢さんはご在席ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, is Nose-san at his seat?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、能勢さん、高田です。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, Nose-san, this is Takada.

conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日はすみません、外出中でお電話に出れませんで。
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry about yesterday, I couldn't pick up the phone as I was out.

conversation.ja_sentence: お願いしていた資料、送ってくれてありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for sending the documents I asked for.

conversation.ja_sentence: 助かりましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It was helpful.

conversation.ja_sentence: 概略を理解するには十分でしたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It was enough to get a general understanding.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、ちょっと具体的に経営陣に話を進めるとなると、少々心もとなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: But I'm not that confident when it comes to actually proceeding with discussions with the management team.

conversation.ja_sentence: 電話で相談するには際どい内容ですから、直接お会いできませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: The content is pretty tricky to discuss over the phone so would it be possible to meet in person?

conversation.ja_sentence: 急で恐縮ですが、今週中にどこかお時間いただけませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Apologies for the sudden request but could you give me some of your time sometimes this week?

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、１３時に弊社でいかがでしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, how about 1 o'clock in the afternoon at our office.

conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります、お会いするまでに相談したいことも整理しておきますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That will be helpful, I will also review what I want to discuss about by the time we meet.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、明日、お待ちしております。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will wait for you tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、阿川です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Akawa.

conversation.ja_sentence: おはよう、どうした？
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, what's going on?

conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫なの？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you alright?

conversation.ja_sentence: 時期が時期だし、インフルエンザに罹った？
conversation.en_sentence: You know it's the flu season, do you think you came down with it?

conversation.ja_sentence: インフルエンザだったら、しっかり直してから出社してもらいたいし。
conversation.en_sentence: If you have the flu, I need you to get completely better before coming back to work.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会社のガイドラインで、発症後５日、解熱後２日で出社可になっていると思う。
conversation.en_sentence: According to our company policy, you can come back 5 days after the onset of the sickness and you have been fever free for 2 days.

conversation.ja_sentence: 診察結果はまた連絡してもらえるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you call me back about the diagnosis later?

conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だよ、お大事にして。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't you worry about that, take care.

conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、今日取り急ぎの案件はあるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: By the way do you have any urgent appointments?

conversation.ja_sentence: リスケジュールできるものなのか、それとも代理で先方に伺った方がいい？
conversation.en_sentence: Can it be rescheduled or do we need to send a someone else there?

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解、先方には私から事情を連絡しておくよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, I will let them know about your situation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 気にしないで養生してね。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry, just get better.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解、お大事にね。
conversation.en_sentence: I got it, take care.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 木檜さん、おはようございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, Satoru!

conversation.en_sentence: Have you heard that our biometric sensor will be on TV soon?

conversation.en_sentence: We'll be on the news show for T Station every Thursday night.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン

conversation.en_sentence: You know "State of the Art Technology of the Week" section in that show, don't you?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はあのコーナーって、一発撮りなんだって。
conversation.en_sentence: I've heard that section is actually shot in one go.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: ウチのラボからは誰が出るの？
conversation.en_sentence: Who's going to be on the show from our lab?

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼なら安心してテレビの前に座ってられるね。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I can relax in front of the TV if he'll be on air.

conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, Kaname!

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ長澤さん、ウチのセンサーがテレビで紹介されるって話をしてたんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, we were just talking about our sensor being introduced on TV, Kaname.

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン

conversation.en_sentence: Argh, why does it have to be on that day, I'll be gone on a business trip!

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン ピーターソン
conversation.ja_sentence: だって、あのレポーターの女の子、ファンなんだよ！
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I'm a fan of that reporter girl!

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、今朝のミーティングはこれくらいかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, so that's about it for the morning meeting today?

conversation.ja_sentence: 社長は最新のやつ出したがったんだけど...。

conversation.ja_sentence: だから、今F社のSフォンに乗せてる虹彩認証センサーを見せる事にしたんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: So, we've decided to show our iris authentication sensor currently mounted on F Corporation's S phone.

conversation.en_sentence: As for our latest sensors, it's probably safer to mention a little at the end of the coverage.

conversation.ja_sentence: そう、当時ウチが開発したばかりの指紋認証センサー、今回みたいなテレビ番組が取り上げられたんだけど。

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら、生放送の取材中にちゃんと作動しなくてね、その場でフォローも出来なくて。
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, it didn't work out properly during the live report, and we couldn't cover for the trouble on the fly either.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回と違って、説得しきれなくて。
